info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 13 at 7:53AM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN LITCHFIELD COUNTY THROUGH 845 AM EDT... At 753 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Oakville, or near Waterbury, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Thomaston, Litchfield, Terryville, Woodbury Center, Northwest Harwinton, Oakville, Watertown, Plymouth, Woodbury, Harwinton, Bethlehem, Morris, Bantam, Grappaville, Hotchkissville, Haight Vineyard, Pequabuck, Reynolds Bridge, Nepaug, and Hancock. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
